des:
The BGE Smart Home skill allows you to monitor and control your home with the power of your voice. You can send commands that control your home's smart plugs, lights and connected thermostat. 

Before you begin: Once you've downloaded the BGE Smart Home app and created your BGE Smart Home account, you can enable this action. You will need to log into your account using the same credentials and link it to your Amazon Alexa. 

To get started: You will need to have your BGE Smart Home gateway and devices installed. Learn more about the BGE Smart Home devices and get helpful installation tips at https://bgesmartenergy.com/residential/smart-home-pilot/participant

Next steps: After you have set up your BGE Smart Home environment, you can begin monitoring and controlling all of your connected devices. Here are some examples of things you can say: 
- "Alexa, turn [on / off] [smart home device / group name]."
- "Alexa, set [smart home device / group name] to [##] %." 
- "Alexa, [brighten / dim] [smart home device / group name]." 
- "Alexa, set [smart home device / group name] temperature to [##] degrees." 
- "Alexa, [increase / decrease] the [smart home device / group name] temperature." 

Grouping Devices: 
This smart home skill allows you to define customized groups of devices right in the Alexa App. For more information on how to manage your groups, visit the Amazon help page: http://tinyurl.com/alexa-smart-home-groups

BGE Smart Home is a pilot program created to help BGE residential customers take greater control of their home's energy use, increase comfort, and lower energy costs. The BGE Smart Home Pilot is funded through the EmPOWER Maryland initiative which aims to help Marylanders reduce energy consumption and save money. EmPOWER programs are funded by a charge on your energy bill. 
Enrollment in this pilot is currently closed.

For more information on how this skill works, visit https://www.bgesmartenergy.com/residential/smart-home-pilot/Amazon-Alexa
